results.title: The Piano. Part 1
results.creator_credit: Muir Mathieson, Ken Cameron, Education Foundation for Visual Arts and World Mirror-Realist Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “We Make Music”.
Denis Matthews traces the history of stringed instruments from before the invention of the keyhboard to the modern pianoforte. Instruments such as the spinet, clavichord and harpsichord are demonstrated.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Muir Mathieson, Ken Cameron, Education Foundation for Visual Arts and World Mirror-Realist Films

results.title: Derek Wickens: the oboe
results.creator_credit: Muir Mathieson, Ken Cameron and Anvil Film and Recording Group
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “We Make Music”.
Derek Wickens, describes the oboe’s complexity and how its tone is generated by its double reed. The history and range of the instrument is described with examples from Dvorak’s “New World” symphony, Richard Strauss’ Concerto for Oboe and Orchestra and part of the Haydn Concerto.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Muir Mathieson, Ken Cameron and Anvil Film and Recording Group
results.description:

Derek Wickens, describes the oboe’s complexity and how its tone is generated by its double reed. The history and range of the instrument is described with examples from Dvorak’s “New World” symphony, Richard Strauss’ Concerto for Oboe and Orchestra and part of the Haydn Concerto.
description_for_label:
Episode of Series “We Make Music”.
Derek Wickens, describes the oboe’s complexity and how its tone is generated by its double reed. The history and range of the instrument is described with examples from Dvorak’s “New World” symphony, Richard Strauss’ Concerto for Oboe and Orchestra and part of the Haydn Concerto.

results.title: The Violin: Manoug Parikian
results.creator_credit: Muir Mathieson, Ken Cameron and World Mirror-Realist Films
results.brief_description:
Episode no. 2 of Series “We Make Music”
The use made of the instrument by composers and violinists during the romantic 18th and 19th centuries Parikian expands his lessons on bowing techniques and explains the duties of the leader, or concert master, of the orchestra.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Muir Mathieson, Ken Cameron and World Mirror-Realist Films

results.title: The Violin: Manoug Parikian
results.creator_credit: Muir Mathieson, Ken Cameron, Anvil Films and Record Group and National Committee for Audio-Visual Aids in Education
results.brief_description:
Episode no. 1 of Series “We Make Music”
Manoug Parikian, the Armenian violinist, talks about his Stradivarius, showing how it is made and the technique of playing. He also traces the development of the violin, from as far back as 3000 BC to the emergence of the violin and its present form in the 15th century.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Muir Mathieson, Ken Cameron, Anvil Films and Record Group and National Committee for Audio-Visual Aids in Education

results.title: The Trumpet
results.creator_credit: Anvil Films and Record Group and National Committee for Audio-Visual Aids in Education
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “We Make Music”.
Philip Jones talks of the history of the trumpet and examines its development. Comparisons are made with the cornet and the bugle, and we see such early instruments as the slide trumpet and the trumpet with crooks. Several famous works for the trumpet are played.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Anvil Films and Record Group and National Committee for Audio-Visual Aids in Education
results.description:
Episode of Series “We Make Music”.
Philip Jones talks of the history of the trumpet and examines its development. Comparisons are made with the cornet and the bugle, and we see such early instruments as the slide trumpet and the trumpet with crooks. Several famous works for the trumpet are played.
description_for_label:
Episode of Series “We Make Music”.
Philip Jones talks of the history of the trumpet and examines its development. Comparisons are made with the cornet and the bugle, and we see such early instruments as the slide trumpet and the trumpet with crooks. Several famous works for the trumpet are played.

results.title: The Trombone
results.creator_credit: Muir Mathieson, Ken Cameron, Anvil Film and Recording Group, Educational Foundation for Visual Aids and World Mirror-Realist Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “We Make Music”
Alfred Flaszynski describes the history of the trombone, its development and the technique of playing, illustrated by excerpts from Ravel’s Bolero and George Lohmann’s Posaune Teufel. The problems of selecting each note by the correct use of the slide and the appropriate harmonic series are dealt with in detail.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Muir Mathieson, Ken Cameron, Anvil Film and Recording Group, Educational Foundation for Visual Aids and World Mirror-Realist Films

The problems of selecting each note by the correct use of the slide and the appropriate harmonic series are dealt with in detail.

results.title: Timpani
results.creator_credit: Muir Mathieson, Ken Cameron, Anvil Films and World Mirror-Realist Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “We Make Music”
A demonstration of the kettle drums, showing the complications of the tuning of each drum to the required pitch. The modern pedal kettle drum has a mechanism for automatic adjustment of the skin. A tuning gauge helps the timpanist to determine his pitch.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Muir Mathieson, Ken Cameron, Anvil Films and World Mirror-Realist Films

results.title: The Piano. Part 2
results.creator_credit: Muir Mathieson, Ken Cameron, Educational Foundation for Visual Aids and World Mirror-Realist Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “We Make Music”.
A study of the expanding technique of pianoforte composition and playing during the 18th and 19th centuries, contrasting the delicacies of a Chopin Nocturne with the enormous complexities of Liszt, Schubert, Schumann, Brahms; many of the other great romantics are discussed and the modern school is touched on.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Muir Mathieson, Ken Cameron, Educational Foundation for Visual Aids and World Mirror-Realist Films

results.title: The Organ. Part 1
results.creator_credit: Muir Mathieson, Ken Cameron and World Mirror-Realist Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “We Make Music”.
Simon Preston, speaking from the console of the great Harrison organ in Westminster Abbey, tells of the history and construction of the instrument. He explains the simple theory of sound generation, the problems of providing constant air pressure, and the complexities of playing. Works by Mozart, Purcell and others are played.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Muir Mathieson, Ken Cameron and World Mirror-Realist Films
results.description:

He explains the simple theory of sound generation, the problems of providing constant air pressure, and the complexities of playing. Works by Mozart, Purcell and others are played.
